alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 27 at 1:17AM PDT until July 03 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Warm temperatures over the holiday weekend will lead to rapidly melting high mountain snowpack with increasing flows in creeks, streams and rivers along the east slopes of the southern Sierra and Owens Valley. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY, JULY 4TH... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following areas, Eastern Sierra Slopes and Owens Valley. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Tuesday, July 4th. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff due to rapid snowmelt may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may impact campgrounds, trails and rural roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A significant warming trend Friday through the holiday weekend will lead to more rapid snowmelt in the high Sierra which will enhance already high runoff along the east slopes of the southern Sierra into the Owens Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Those planning outdoor recreation over the holiday weekend should stay out of the cold fast-flowing creeks, streams and rivers.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley
